definition: Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
bright/opposite: dark 暗[an4]/(of meaning) clear/to understand/next/public or open/wise/generic term for a sacrifice to the gods

sentences.english: The faster the waves come, the more deliberately we need to navigate.
sentences.chinese: 浪潮來的越快，我們越是需要有意識地辨明方向。

sentences.english: It’s better to go into a restaurant or club in order to find your directions.
sentences.chinese: 最好走進飯店或者俱樂部來辨明你的方位。

sentences.english: They teach us how to tell good form bad and help us make progress in every field .
sentences.chinese: 他們教導我們辨明是非，輔助我們在各方面獲得進步。

sentences.english: Semantic technology can discern what it is.
sentences.chinese: 語義技術可以辨明真相。

sentences.english: I must identify it, and then run.
sentences.chinese: 我必須要辨明它，且放膽奔跑。

sentences.english: On a fine summer night travellers can go by the Dipper.
sentences.chinese: 夏天晴夜，旅行的人可根據北斗星辨明方向。

sentences.english: The fast different that ⑤ cardiogram discerns hard temporarily rhythm of the heart, the person that illness danger is weighed.
sentences.chinese: 心電圖一時難以辨明的快速異位心律，病情危重者。

sentences.english: The vital importance of the early recognition of perforating appendix is unmistakable .
sentences.chinese: 能夠早期辨明闌尾正在穿孔是極端重要的。

sentences.english: Whence the urgency that the sense of this word be discernible.
sentences.chinese: 這個文字的意義應該被辨明的迫切性，從何而來？

sentences.english: The gegenschein is distinguished from zodiacal light by the high angle of reflection.
sentences.chinese: 對日照通過高角反射在黃道帶的光圈中很容易辨明。

sentences.english: Having made up his mind, he immediately identified directions and strode off in the direction of Infinity Mountains.
sentences.chinese: 心意已決，當即辨明方向，邁開大步，趕向無量山去。

definition: to differentiate/to distinguish/to discriminate/also written 辨別|辨别
to make a definitive judgment/to come to a firm conclusion
to study/to examine/to probe/to study the underlying principles
what is true and what is false/(to get to know) the real situation
to find out/to search out/to uncover/to discover
true or false?/correct or incorrect/to correct errors (in a document)
